00264 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00265 
00266 /* data type sizes */
00267 INT mtid_size[] = {
00268    0,                           /* tid == 0 not defined                               */
00269    1,                           /* TID_BYTE      unsigned byte         0       255    */
00270    1,                           /* TID_SBYTE     signed byte         -128      127    */
00271    1,                           /* TID_CHAR      single character      0       255    */
00272    2,                           /* TID_WORD      two bytes             0      65535   */
00273    2,                           /* TID_SHORT     signed word        -32768    32767   */
00274    4,                           /* TID_DWORD     four bytes            0      2^32-1  */
00275    4,                           /* TID_INT       signed dword        -2^31    2^31-1  */
00276    4,                           /* TID_BOOL      four bytes bool       0        1     */
00277    4,                           /* TID_FLOAT     4 Byte float format                  */
00278    8,                           /* TID_DOUBLE    8 Byte float format                  */
00279    1,                           /* TID_BITFIELD  8 Bits Bitfield    00000000 11111111 */
00280    0,                           /* TID_STRING    zero terminated string               */
00281    0,                           /* TID_ARRAY     variable length array of unkown type */
00282    0,                           /* TID_STRUCT    C structure                          */
00283    0,                           /* TID_KEY       key in online database               */
00284    0                            /* TID_LINK      link in online database              */
00285 };

00289 #define N_MAX_CONNECTION      10
00290 #define NET_BUFFER_SIZE   100000
00291 
00292 int rpc_sock[N_MAX_CONNECTION];
00293 char net_buffer[NET_BUFFER_SIZE];
00294 char recv_buffer[NET_BUFFER_SIZE];
00295 
00296 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00297 
00298 void debug_log(char *format, ...)
00299 {
00300    int fh;
00301    char str[256];
00302    va_list argptr;
00303 
00304    if (!_debug_flag)
00305       return;
00306 
00307    va_start(argptr, format);
00308    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
00309    va_end(argptr);
00310 
00311    /* if debug flag equals 2, write to stdout */
00312    if (_debug_flag == 2)
00313       write(fileno(stdout), str, strlen(str));
00314    else {
00315       /* else write to file */
00316       fh = open("mscb_debug.log", O_CREAT | O_WRONLY | O_APPEND, 0644);
00317       if (fh < 0)
00318          return;
00319 
00320       write(fh, str, strlen(str));
00321       close(fh);
00322    }
00323 }
00324 
00325 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00326 
00327 int mrecv_tcp(int sock, char *buffer, int buffer_size)
00328 {
00329    INT param_size, n_received, n;
00330    NET_COMMAND *nc;
00331 
00332    if (buffer_size < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
00333       printf("mrecv_tcp_server: buffer too small\n");
00334       return -1;
00335    }
00336 
00337    /* first receive header */
00338    n_received = 0;
00339    do {
00340       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), 0);
00341 
00342       if (n <= 0)
00343          return n;
00344 
00345       n_received += n;
00346 
00347    } while (n_received < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER));
00348 
00349    /* now receive parameters */
00350 
00351    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
00352    param_size = nc->header.param_size;
00353    n_received = 0;
00354 
00355    if (param_size == 0)
00356       return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
00357 
00358    do {
00359       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received,
00360                param_size - n_received, 0);
00361 
00362       if (n <= 0)
00363          return n;
00364 
00365       n_received += n;
00366    } while (n_received < param_size);
00367 
00368    return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size;
00369 }
00370 
00371 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00372 
00373 int msend_tcp(int sock, char *buffer, int buffer_size)
00374 {
00375    int count, status;
00376 
00377    /* transfer fragments until complete buffer is transferred */
00378 
00379    for (count = 0; (int) count < (int) buffer_size - NET_TCP_SIZE;) {
00380       status = send(sock, buffer + count, NET_TCP_SIZE, 0);
00381       if (status != -1)
00382          count += status;
00383       else
00384          return status;
00385    }
00386 
00387    while (count < buffer_size) {
00388       status = send(sock, buffer + count, buffer_size - count, 0);
00389       if (status != -1)
00390          count += status;
00391       else
00392          return status;
00393    }
00394 
00395    return count;
00396 }

00398 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00399 
00400 int server_execute(int index, void *prpc_param[])
00401 {
00402    int status;
00403 
00404    switch (index) {
00405    default:
00406       abort();
00407       break;
00408 
00409    case RPC_MSCB_INIT:
00410       status = mscb_init(CSTRING(0), CINT(1), CINT(2));
00411       break;
00412 
00413    case RPC_MSCB_EXIT:
00414       status = mscb_exit(CINT(0));
00415       break;
00416 
00417    case RPC_MSCB_REBOOT:
00418       status = mscb_reboot(CINT(0), CINT(1));
00419       break;
00420 
00421    case RPC_MSCB_RESET:
00422       status = mscb_reset(CINT(0));
00423       break;
00424 
00425    case RPC_MSCB_PING:
00426       status = mscb_ping(CINT(0), CINT(1));
00427       break;
00428 
00429    case RPC_MSCB_INFO:
00430       status = mscb_info(CINT(0), CINT(1), CARRAY(2));
00431       break;
00432 
00433    case RPC_MSCB_INFO_VARIABLE:
00434       status = mscb_info_variable(CINT(0), CINT(1), CINT(2), CARRAY(3));
00435       break;
00436 
00437    case RPC_MSCB_SET_ADDR:
00438       status = mscb_set_addr(CINT(0), CINT(1), CINT(2), CINT(3));
00439       break;
00440 
00441    case RPC_MSCB_SET_NAME:
00442       status = mscb_set_name(CINT(0), CINT(1), CSTRING(2));
00443       break;
00444 
00445    case RPC_MSCB_WRITE_GROUP:
00446       status = mscb_write_group(CINT(0), CINT(1), CBYTE(2), CARRAY(3), CINT(4));
00447       break;
00448 
00449    case RPC_MSCB_WRITE:
00450       status = mscb_write(CINT(0), CINT(1), CBYTE(2), CARRAY(3), CINT(4));
00451       break;
00452 
00453    case RPC_MSCB_FLASH:
00454       status = mscb_flash(CINT(0), CINT(1));
00455       break;
00456 
00457    case RPC_MSCB_UPLOAD:
00458       status = mscb_upload(CINT(0), CINT(1), CARRAY(2), CINT(3), CINT(4));
00459       break;
00460 
00461    case RPC_MSCB_READ:
00462       status = mscb_read(CINT(0), CINT(1), CBYTE(2), CARRAY(3), CPINT(4));
00463       break;
00464 
00465    case RPC_MSCB_READ_RANGE:
00466       status = mscb_read_range(CINT(0), CINT(1), CBYTE(2), CBYTE(3), CARRAY(4), CPINT(5));
00467       break;
00468 
00469    case RPC_MSCB_ECHO:
00470       status = mscb_echo(CINT(0), CINT(1), CBYTE(2), CPBYTE(3));
00471       break;
00472 
00473    case RPC_MSCB_USER:
00474       status = mscb_user(CINT(0), CINT(1), CARRAY(2), CINT(3), CARRAY(4), CPINT(5));
00475       break;
00476 
00477    case RPC_MSCB_ADDR:
00478       status = mscb_addr(CINT(0), CINT(1), CINT(2), CINT(3), CINT(4));
00479       break;
00480    }
00481 
00482    return status;
00483 }
00484 
00485 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00486 
00487 int mrpc_execute(int sock, char *buffer)
00488 {
00489    INT i, index, routine_id, status;
00490    char *in_param_ptr, *out_param_ptr, *last_param_ptr;
00491    INT tid, flags;
00492    NET_COMMAND *nc_in, *nc_out;
00493    INT param_size, max_size;
00494    void *prpc_param[20];
00495    char return_buffer[NET_BUFFER_SIZE];
00496 
00497    /* extract pointer array to parameters */
00498    nc_in = (NET_COMMAND *) buffer;
00499    nc_out = (NET_COMMAND *) return_buffer;
00500 
00501    /* find entry in rpc_list */
00502    routine_id = nc_in->header.routine_id;
00503 
00504    for (i = 0;; i++)
00505       if (rpc_list[i].id == 0 || rpc_list[i].id == routine_id)
00506          break;
00507    index = i;
00508    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
00509       printf("mrpc_execute: Invalid rpc ID (%d)\n", routine_id);
00510       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
00511    }
00512 
00513    in_param_ptr = nc_in->param;
00514    out_param_ptr = nc_out->param;
00515 
00516    for (i = 0; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
00517       tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00518       flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
00519 
00520       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
00521          param_size = ALIGN8(mtid_size[tid]);
00522 
00523          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
00524             param_size = ALIGN8(1 + strlen((char *) (in_param_ptr)));
00525 
00526          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
00527             /* for arrays, the size is stored as a INT in front of the array */
00528             param_size = *((INT *) in_param_ptr);
00529             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
00530 
00531             in_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
00532          }
00533 
00534          if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
00535             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[index].param[i].n);
00536 
00537          prpc_param[i] = in_param_ptr;
00538 
00539          in_param_ptr += param_size;
00540       }
00541 
00542       if (flags & RPC_OUT) {
00543          param_size = ALIGN8(mtid_size[tid]);
00544 
00545          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY || tid == TID_STRING) {
00546             /* save maximum array length */
00547             max_size = *((INT *) in_param_ptr);
00548             max_size = ALIGN8(max_size);
00549 
00550             *((INT *) out_param_ptr) = max_size;
00551 
00552             /* save space for return array length */
00553             out_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
00554 
00555             /* use maximum array length from input */
00556             param_size += max_size;
00557          }
00558 
00559          if (rpc_list[index].param[i].tid == TID_STRUCT)
00560             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[index].param[i].n);
00561 
00562          if ((int) out_param_ptr - (int) nc_out + param_size > NET_BUFFER_SIZE) {
00563             printf
00564                 ("mrpc_execute: return parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)\n",
00565                  (int) out_param_ptr - (int) nc_out + param_size, NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
00566             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
00567          }
00568 
00569          /* if parameter goes both directions, copy input to output */
00570          if (rpc_list[index].param[i].flags & RPC_IN)
00571             memcpy(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], param_size);
00572 
00573          prpc_param[i] = out_param_ptr;
00574          out_param_ptr += param_size;
00575       }
00576 
00577    }
00578 
00579    last_param_ptr = out_param_ptr;
00580 
00581   /*********************************\
00582   *   call dispatch function        *
00583   \*********************************/
00584    status = server_execute(routine_id, prpc_param);
00585 
00586    /* compress variable length arrays */
00587    out_param_ptr = nc_out->param;
00588    for (i = 0; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++)
00589       if (rpc_list[index].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
00590          tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00591          flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
00592          param_size = ALIGN8(mtid_size[tid]);
00593 
00594          if (tid == TID_STRING) {
00595             max_size = *((INT *) out_param_ptr);
00596             param_size = strlen((char *) prpc_param[i]) + 1;
00597             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
00598 
00599             /* move string ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)) left */
00600             memcpy(out_param_ptr, out_param_ptr + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)), param_size);
00601 
00602             /* move remaining parameters to end of string */
00603             memcpy(out_param_ptr + param_size,
00604                    out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)),
00605                    (int) last_param_ptr -
00606                    ((int) out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT))));
00607          }
00608 
00609          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
00610             /* store array length at current out_param_ptr */
00611             max_size = *((INT *) out_param_ptr);
00612             param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
00613             *((INT *) out_param_ptr) = param_size;
00614 
00615             out_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
00616 
00617             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
00618 
00619             /* move remaining parameters to end of array */
00620             memcpy(out_param_ptr + param_size,
00621                    out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)),
00622                    (int) last_param_ptr -
00623                    ((int) out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT))));
00624          }
00625 
00626          if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
00627             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[index].param[i].n);
00628 
00629          out_param_ptr += param_size;
00630       }
00631 
00632    /* send return parameters */
00633    param_size = (int) out_param_ptr - (int) nc_out->param;
00634    nc_out->header.routine_id = status;
00635    nc_out->header.param_size = param_size;
00636 
00637    status = msend_tcp(sock, return_buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size);
00638 
00639    if (status < 0) {
00640       printf("mrpc_execute: msend_tcp() failed\n");
00641       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
00642    }
00643 
00644    return RPC_SUCCESS;
00645 }
00646 
00647 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00648 
00649 int mrpc_connect(char *host_name)
00650 {
00651    INT status, sock;
00652    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
00653    struct hostent *phe;
00654 
00655 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00656    {
00657       WSADATA WSAData;
00658 
00659       /* Start windows sockets */
00660       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
00661          return -1;
00662    }
00663 #endif
00664 
00665    /* create a new socket for connecting to remote server */
00666    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00667    if (sock == -1) {
00668       perror("mrpc_connect");
00669       return -1;
00670    }
00671 
00672    /* let OS choose any port number */
00673    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
00674    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00675    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
00676    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
00677 
00678    status = bind(sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
00679    if (status < 0) {
00680       perror("mrpc_connect");
00681       return -1;
00682    }
00683 
00684    /* connect to remote node */
00685    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
00686    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00687    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
00688    bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) MSCB_RPC_PORT);
00689 
00690    phe = gethostbyname(host_name);
00691    if (phe == NULL) {
00692       perror("mrpc_connect");
00693       return -1;
00694    }
00695    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
00696 
00697    status = connect(sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
00698    if (status != 0) {
00699       perror("mrpc_connect");
00700       return -1;
00701    }
00702 
00703    return sock;
00704 }
00705 
00706 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00707 
00708 int mrpc_disconnect(int sock)
00709 {
00710    closesocket(sock);
00711    return RPC_SUCCESS;
00712 }
00713 
00714 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00715 
00716 void mrpc_va_arg(va_list * arg_ptr, int arg_type, void *arg)
00717 {
00718    switch (arg_type) {
00719       /* On the stack, the minimum parameter size is sizeof(int).
00720          To avoid problems on little endian systems, treat all
00721          smaller parameters as int's */
00722    case TID_BYTE:
00723    case TID_SBYTE:
00724    case TID_CHAR:
00725    case TID_WORD:
00726    case TID_SHORT:
00727       *((int *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, int);
00728       break;
00729 
00730    case TID_INT:
00731    case TID_BOOL:
00732       *((INT *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, INT);
00733       break;
00734 
00735    case TID_DWORD:
00736       *((unsigned int *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, unsigned int);
00737       break;
00738 
00739       /* float variables are passed as double by the compiler */
00740    case TID_FLOAT:
00741       *((float *) arg) = (float) va_arg(*arg_ptr, double);
00742       break;
00743 
00744    case TID_DOUBLE:
00745       *((double *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, double);
00746       break;
00747 
00748    case TID_ARRAY:
00749       *((char **) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, char *);
00750       break;
00751    }
00752 }
00753 
00754 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00755 
00756 int mrpc_call(int sock, const int routine_id, ...)
00757 {
00758    va_list ap, aptmp;
00759    char str[256], arg[8], arg_tmp[8];
00760    INT arg_type;
00761    INT i, index, status;
00762    INT param_size, arg_size, send_size;
00763    INT tid, flags;
00764    fd_set readfds;
00765    struct timeval timeout;
00766    char *param_ptr;
00767    int bpointer;
00768    NET_COMMAND *nc;
00769    time_t now;
00770 
00771    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
00772    nc->header.routine_id = routine_id;
00773 
00774    for (i = 0;; i++)
00775       if (rpc_list[i].id == routine_id || rpc_list[i].id == 0)
00776          break;
00777    index = i;
00778    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
00779       printf("mrpc_call: invalid rpc ID (%d)\n", routine_id);
00780       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
00781    }
00782 
00783    time(&now);
00784    strcpy(str, ctime(&now));
00785    str[19] = 0;
00786    debug_log("%s %s (", str + 4, rpc_list[i].name);
00787 
00788    /* examine variable argument list and convert it to parameter array */
00789    va_start(ap, routine_id);
00790 
00791    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
00792       tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00793       flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
00794 
00795       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
00796           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
00797           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
00798 
00799       if (bpointer)
00800          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
00801       else
00802          arg_type = tid;
00803 
00804       /* floats are passed as doubles, at least under NT */
00805       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
00806          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
00807 
00808       /* get pointer to argument */
00809       mrpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
00810 
00811       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
00812          if (bpointer)
00813             arg_size = mtid_size[tid];
00814          else
00815             arg_size = mtid_size[arg_type];
00816 
00817          /* for strings, the argument size depends on the string length */
00818          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
00819             arg_size = 1 + strlen((char *) *((char **) arg));
00820 
00821          /* for varibale length arrays, the size is given by
00822             the next parameter on the stack */
00823          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
00824             memcpy(&aptmp, &ap, sizeof(ap));
00825             mrpc_va_arg(&aptmp, TID_ARRAY, arg_tmp);
00826 
00827             if (flags & RPC_OUT)
00828                arg_size = *((INT *) * ((void **) arg_tmp));
00829             else
00830                arg_size = *((INT *) arg_tmp);
00831 
00832             *((INT *) param_ptr) = ALIGN8(arg_size);
00833             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
00834          }
00835 
00836          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
00837             arg_size = rpc_list[index].param[i].n;
00838 
00839          /* always align parameter size */
00840          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
00841 
00842          if ((int) param_ptr - (int) nc + param_size > NET_BUFFER_SIZE) {
00843             printf
00844                 ("mrpc_call: parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)\n",
00845                  (int) param_ptr - (int) nc + param_size, NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
00846             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
00847          }
00848 
00849          if (bpointer)
00850             memcpy(param_ptr, (void *) *((void **) arg), arg_size);
00851          else {
00852             /* floats are passed as doubles on most systems */
00853             if (tid != TID_FLOAT)
00854                memcpy(param_ptr, arg, arg_size);
00855             else
00856                *((float *) param_ptr) = (float) *((double *) arg);
00857          }
00858 
00859          switch (tid) {
00860          case TID_BYTE:
00861             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned char *) param_ptr));
00862             break;
00863          case TID_SBYTE:
00864             debug_log(" %d", *((char *) param_ptr));
00865             break;
00866          case TID_CHAR:
00867             debug_log(" %c", *((char *) param_ptr));
00868             break;
00869          case TID_WORD:
00870             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned short *) param_ptr));
00871             break;
00872          case TID_SHORT:
00873             debug_log(" %d", *((short *) param_ptr));
00874             break;
00875          case TID_DWORD:
00876             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned int *) param_ptr));
00877             break;
00878          case TID_INT:
00879             debug_log(" %d", *((int *) param_ptr));
00880             break;
00881          case TID_BOOL:
00882             debug_log(" %d", *((int *) param_ptr));
00883             break;
00884          case TID_FLOAT:
00885             debug_log(" %f", *((float *) param_ptr));
00886             break;
00887          case TID_DOUBLE:
00888             debug_log(" %lf", *((double *) param_ptr));
00889             break;
00890          case TID_STRING:
00891             debug_log(" %s", (char *) param_ptr);
00892             break;
00893 
00894          default:
00895             debug_log(" *");
00896             break;
00897          }
00898 
00899          param_ptr += param_size;
00900 
00901       }
00902    }
00903 
00904    debug_log(" ) : (");
00905 
00906    va_end(ap);
00907 
00908    nc->header.param_size = (int) param_ptr - (int) nc->param;
00909 
00910    send_size = nc->header.param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
00911 
00912    /* send and wait for reply on send socket */
00913    i = msend_tcp(sock, (char *) nc, send_size);
00914    if (i != send_size) {
00915       printf("mrpc_call: msend_tcp() failed\n");
00916       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
00917    }
00918 
00919    /* make some timeout checking */
00920    FD_ZERO(&readfds);
00921    FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
00922 
00923    timeout.tv_sec = RPC_TIMEOUT / 1000;
00924    timeout.tv_usec = (RPC_TIMEOUT % 1000) * 1000;
00925 
00926    select(FD_SETSIZE, (void *) &readfds, NULL, NULL, (void *) &timeout);
00927 
00928    if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
00929       printf("mrpc_call: rpc timeout, routine = \"%s\"\n", rpc_list[index].name);
00930 
00931       /* disconnect to avoid that the reply to this mrpc_call comes at
00932          the next mrpc_call */
00933       closesocket(sock);
00934 
00935       return RPC_ERR_TIMEOUT;
00936    }
00937 
00938    /* receive result on send socket */
00939    i = mrecv_tcp(sock, net_buffer, NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
00940 
00941    if (i <= 0) {
00942       printf("mrpc_call: mrecv_tcp() failed, routine = \"%s\"\n", rpc_list[index].name);
00943       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
00944    }
00945 
00946    /* extract result variables and place it to argument list */
00947    status = nc->header.routine_id;
00948 
00949    va_start(ap, routine_id);
00950 
00951    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
00952       tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00953       flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
00954 
00955       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
00956           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
00957           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
00958 
00959       if (bpointer)
00960          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
00961       else
00962          arg_type = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00963 
00964       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
00965          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
00966 
00967       mrpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
00968 
00969       if (rpc_list[index].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
00970          tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
00971          arg_size = mtid_size[tid];
00972 
00973          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
00974             arg_size = strlen((char *) (param_ptr)) + 1;
00975 
00976          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
00977             arg_size = *((INT *) param_ptr);
00978             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
00979          }
00980 
00981          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
00982             arg_size = rpc_list[index].param[i].n;
00983 
00984          /* return parameters are always pointers */
00985          if (*((char **) arg))
00986             memcpy((void *) *((char **) arg), param_ptr, arg_size);
00987 
00988          /* parameter size is always aligned */
00989          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
00990 
00991          switch (tid) {
00992          case TID_BYTE:
00993             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned char *) param_ptr));
00994             break;
00995          case TID_SBYTE:
00996             debug_log(" %d", *((char *) param_ptr));
00997             break;
00998          case TID_CHAR:
00999             debug_log(" %c", *((char *) param_ptr));
01000             break;
01001          case TID_WORD:
01002             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned short *) param_ptr));
01003             break;
01004          case TID_SHORT:
01005             debug_log(" %d", *((short *) param_ptr));
01006             break;
01007          case TID_DWORD:
01008             debug_log(" %d", *((unsigned int *) param_ptr));
01009             break;
01010          case TID_INT:
01011             debug_log(" %d", *((int *) param_ptr));
01012             break;
01013          case TID_BOOL:
01014             debug_log(" %d", *((int *) param_ptr));
01015             break;
01016          case TID_FLOAT:
01017             debug_log(" %f", *((float *) param_ptr));
01018             break;
01019          case TID_DOUBLE:
01020             debug_log(" %lf", *((double *) param_ptr));
01021             break;
01022          case TID_STRING:
01023             debug_log(" %s", (char *) param_ptr);
01024             break;
01025 
01026          default:
01027             debug_log(" *");
01028             break;
01029          }
01030 
01031          param_ptr += param_size;
01032       }
01033    }
01034 
01035    debug_log(" ) : %d\n", status);
01036 
01037    va_end(ap);
01038 
01039    return status;
01040 }
01041 
01042 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01043 
01044 extern void mscb_cleanup(int sock);
01045 int _server_sock = 0;
01046 
01047 void mrpc_server_loop(void)
01048 {
01049    int i, status, sock, lsock, len, flag;
01050    struct sockaddr_in serv_addr, acc_addr;
01051    char str[256];
01052    struct hostent *phe;
01053    fd_set readfds;
01054    struct timeval timeout;
01055 
01056 #ifdef _MSC_VER
01057    {
01058       WSADATA WSAData;
01059 
01060       /* Start windows sockets */
01061       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
01062          return;
01063    }
01064 #endif
01065 
01066    /* create a new socket */
01067    lsock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01068 
01069    if (lsock == -1) {
01070       perror("mrpc_server_loop");
01071       return;
01072    }
01073 
01074    /* bind local node name and port to socket */
01075    memset(&serv_addr, 0, sizeof(serv_addr));
01076    serv_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
01077 
01078    serv_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
01079    serv_addr.sin_port = htons((short) MSCB_RPC_PORT);
01080 
01081    /* try reusing address */
01082    flag = 1;
01083    setsockopt(lsock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
01084 
01085    status = bind(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &serv_addr, sizeof(serv_addr));
01086    if (status < 0) {
01087       perror("mrpc_server_loop");
01088       return;
01089    }
01090 
01091    /* listen for connection */
01092    status = listen(lsock, SOMAXCONN);
01093    if (status < 0) {
01094       perror("mrpc_server_loop");
01095       return;
01096    }
01097 
01098    printf("Server listening...\n");
01099    do {
01100       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01101       FD_SET(lsock, &readfds);
01102 
01103       for (i = 0; i < N_MAX_CONNECTION; i++)
01104          if (rpc_sock[i] > 0)
01105             FD_SET(rpc_sock[i], &readfds);
01106 
01107       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
01108       timeout.tv_usec = 100000;
01109 
01110       status = select(FD_SETSIZE, (void *) &readfds, NULL, NULL, (void *) &timeout);
01111 
01112       if (FD_ISSET(lsock, &readfds)) {
01113          len = sizeof(acc_addr);
01114          sock = accept(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, &len);
01115 
01116          /* find new entry in socket table */
01117          for (i = 0; i < N_MAX_CONNECTION; i++)
01118             if (rpc_sock[i] == 0)
01119                break;
01120 
01121          if (i == N_MAX_CONNECTION) {
01122             printf("Maximum number of connections exceeded\n");
01123             closesocket(sock);
01124          } else {
01125             rpc_sock[i] = sock;
01126 
01127             phe = gethostbyaddr((char *) &acc_addr.sin_addr, 4, AF_INET);
01128             if (phe != NULL)
01129                strcpy(str, phe->h_name);
01130             else
01131                strcpy(str, (char *) inet_ntoa(acc_addr.sin_addr));
01132 
01133             printf("Open new connection from %s\n", str);
01134          }
01135       } else {
01136          /* check if open connection received data */
01137          for (i = 0; i < N_MAX_CONNECTION; i++)
01138             if (rpc_sock[i] > 0 && FD_ISSET(rpc_sock[i], &readfds)) {
01139                len = mrecv_tcp(rpc_sock[i], net_buffer, NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
01140                if (len < 0) {
01141                   /* remove stale fd */
01142                   mscb_cleanup(rpc_sock[i]);
01143 
01144                   /* close broken connection */
01145                   printf("Close connection\n");
01146                   closesocket(rpc_sock[i]);
01147                   rpc_sock[i] = 0;
01148                } else {
01149                   _server_sock = rpc_sock[i];
01150                   mrpc_execute(rpc_sock[i], net_buffer);
01151                }
01152             }
01153       }
01154 
01155    } while (1);
01156 
01157    printf("Server aborted.\n");
01158 }
Generated on 6 Jun 2014 for AlcapDAQ:Rootana by  1.6.1
